sections.heading: Newspapers eligible to publish notices
sections.text:

sections.heading: Fees for publishing notices
sections.text:
(a)The fees allowed for the publications provided in this chapter shall not exceed one-half (½) of the legal rate provided by law for the publication of legal notices except in the case of a newspaper having a sworn circulation of more than five thousand (5,000) when full legal rates shall be paid.(b)(1)All accounts under §1-3-103shall be paid by the state when approved by the Arkansas Public Service Commission or the State Highway Commission, as appropriate.(2)All accounts for publications under §1-3-105shall be paid by the improvement districts making the publications when the publications have been approved by the commissioners of the districts.Amended by Act 2021, No. 463,§ 2, eff. 7/28/2021.Init. sections.heading: Publications in more than one newspaper
sections.text:

sections.heading: Printing of publication cost
sections.text:
(a)All newspapers publishing anything under the provisions of §§1-3-101,1-3-103, and1-3-105-1-3-109shall print free of charge at the head of each of the publications, in type of double the size of the publication itself, the following words: "The cost of this publication to the taxpayers is the sum of __________________ dollars."(b)Any newspaper or proprietor or editor of any newspaper failing to comply with this section shall be guilty of a violation and upon conviction shall be fined in any sum not less than one hundred dollars ($100) nor more than five hundred dollars ($500).Acts 1915, No. 83, §§ 1, 2; A.S.A. 1947, § 15-201n; Acts 2005, No. 1994, § 1.
